snippet: Finance ministers debated establishing one banking supervisor under the aegis of the European Central Bank for the 6,000 lenders in the euro area.
abstract: European Union finance ministers seek to overcome differences about how to regulate banks after sharp and public disagreement on proposals to make Greece's debt sustainable into the next decade; plan to establish one banking supervisor under the protection of the European Central Bank for the 6,000 lenders in the euro area dominates talks as Greece's plight still threatens to derail the euro zone after dragging on for more than two years.

byline.contributor: Niki Kitsantonis contributed reporting from Athens.

lead_paragraph: Finance ministers debated establishing one banking supervisor under the aegis of the European Central Bank for the 6,000 lenders in the euro area.

headline.seo: Europe Seeks Accord on Bank Regulation After Split on Greek Debt
headline.main: Europe Seeks Accord on Bank Regulation After Disagreement on Greek Debt
headline.print_headline: Europe Seeks Accord on Bank Regulation After Disagreement on Greek Debt
